title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 53.11 - Provisions relating to certain after-market brake linings
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 53.11 - Provisions relating to certain after-market brake linings

State Regulations
(a) Aftermarket
brake linings manufactured or distributed prior to July 1, 1966, may meet the
identification requirements of this Part by having the necessary information
specified in section
53.6
of this Part affixed on the
face of the brake lining, or while such brake linings are in the original box
or container, on such box or container. (b) The lack of identification as required in
section
53.6
or subdivision (a) of this
section on any after-market brake lining manufactured or distributed prior to

July 1, 1966, shall be presumptive evidence that such brake lining has not been
approved. Such presumption may be overcome by certification from the
manufacturer of the lining that such lining was produced from a formulation
which is approved, indicating the formulation number from which such lining was
produced and the date such formulation was approved. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
53.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
